senses.synonym: 15253815-n (the time of day when a bar sells alcoholic drinks at a reduced price)

relations.target: discount=00362929-n (the act of reducing the selling price of merchandise);13295620-n (an amount or percentage deducted);13303298-n (a refund of some fraction of the amount paid);13340275-n (interest on an annual basis deducted in advance on a loan);00802592-v (bar from attention or consideration; \""She dismissed his advances\"");02324408-v (give a reduction in price on; \""I never discount these books-they sell like hot cakes\""

drink=00749813-n (the act of drinking alcoholic beverages to excess; \""drink was his downfall\"");00841439-n (the act of swallowing; \""one swallow of the liquid was enough\""; \""he took a drink of his beer and smacked his lips\"");07897775-n (any liquid suitable for drinking; \""may I take your beverage order?\"");07901198-n (a single serving of a beverage; \""I asked for a hot drink\""; \""likes a drink before dinner\"");09293414-n (any large deep body of water; \""he jumped into the drink and had to be rescued\"");00739010-v (be fascinated or spell-bound by; pay close attention to; \""The mother drinks in every word of her son on the stage\"");01172332-v (take in liquids; \""The patient must drink several liters each day\""; \""The children like to drink soda\"");01173463-v (consume alcohol; \""We were up drinking all night\"");01174572-v (drink excessive amounts of alcohol; be an alcoholic; \""The husband drinks and beats his wife\"");01177764-v (propose a toast to; \""Let us toast the birthday girl!\""; \""Let's drink to the New Year\""
pub=04024793-n (tavern consisting of a building with a bar and public rooms; often provides light meals)

bar=01079274-n (the act of preventing; \""there was no bar against leaving\""; \""money was allocated to study the cause and prevention of influenza\"");02791712-n (a rigid piece of metal or wood; usually used as a fastening or obstruction or weapon; \""there were bars in the windows to prevent escape\"");02792294-n (an obstruction (usually metal) placed at the top of a goal; \""it was an excellent kick but the ball hit the bar\"");02792510-n (a counter where you can obtain food or drink; \""he bought a hot dog and a coke at the bar\"");02792793-n ((law) a railing that encloses the part of the courtroom where the judges and lawyers sit and the case is tried; \""spectators were not allowed past the bar\"");02793035-n (a heating element in an electric fire; \""an electric fire with three bars\"");02793177-n (a horizontal rod that serves as a support for gymnasts as they perform exercises);02800154-n (a room or establishment where alcoholic drinks are served over a counter; \""he drowned his sorrows in whiskey at the bar\"");02940853-n (a block of solid substance (such as soap or wax); \""a bar of chocolate\"");04690493-n (a narrow marking of a different color or texture from the background; \""a green toad with small black stripes or bars\""; \""may the Stars and Stripes forever wave\"");06877775-n (musical notation for a repeating pattern of musical beats; \""the orchestra omitted the last twelve bars of the song\"");08129368-n (the body of individuals qualified to practice law in a particular jurisdiction; \""he was admitted to the bar in New Jersey\"");09236967-n (a submerged (or partly submerged) ridge in a river or along a shore; \""the boat ran aground on a submerged bar in the river\"");13733960-n ((meteorology) a unit of pressure equal to a million dynes per square centimeter; \""unfortunately some writers have used bar for one dyne per square centimeter\"");00798250-v (prevent from entering; keep out; \""He was barred from membership in the club\"");01345592-v (secure with, or as if with, bars; \""He barred the door\"");01480632-v (render unsuitable for passage; \""block the way\""; \""barricade the streets\""; \""stop the busy road\"");02509452-v (expel, as if by official decree; \""he was banished from his own country\""

evening=15191509-n (the latter part of the day (the period of decreasing daylight from late afternoon until nightfall); \""he enjoyed the evening light across the lake\"");15192953-n (the early part of night (from dinner until bedtime) spent in a special way; \""an evening at the opera\"");15292923-n (a later concluding time period; \""it was the evening of the Roman Empire\""
afternoon=06645314-n (a conventional expression of greeting or farewell);15191238-n (the part of the day between noon and evening; \""he spent a quiet afternoon in the park\""

time=00028468-n (the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past; \""he waited for along time\""; \""it took some time before he got an answer\""; \""time flies like an arrow\"");04998860-n (rhythm as given by division into parts of equal duration);07302920-n (a person's experience on a particular occasion; \""he had a time holding back the tears\""; \""they had a good time together\"");07324217-n (an instance or single occasion for some event; \""this time he succeeded\""; \""he called four times\""; \""he could do ten at a clip\"");15147173-n (an indefinite period (usually marked by specific attributes or activities); \""the time of year for planting\""; \""he was a great actor in his time\"");15154879-n (a reading of a point in time as given by a clock; \""do you know what time it is?\""; \""the time is 10 o'clock\"");15160774-n (the fourth coordinate that is required (along with three spatial dimensions) to specify a physical event);15249488-n (the period of time a prisoner is imprisoned; \""he served a prison term of 15 months\""; \""his sentence was 5 to 10 years\""; \""he is doing time in the county jail\"");15270326-n (a suitable moment; \""it is time to go\"");15295388-n (a period of time considered as a resource under your control and sufficient to accomplish something; \""take time to smell the roses\""; \""I didn't have time to finish\""; \""it took more than half my time\""; \""he waited for a long time\"");00297754-v (adjust so that a force is applied and an action occurs at the desired time; \""The good player times his swing so as to hit the ball squarely\"");00298687-v (regulate or set the time of; \""time the clock\"");00491904-v (measure the time or duration of an event or action or the person who performs an action in a certain period of time; \""he clocked the runners\"");00680466-v (assign a time for an activity or event; \""The candidate carefully timed his appearance at the disaster scene\"");00703992-v (set the speed, duration, or execution of; \""we time the process to manufacture our cars very precisely\""

senses.definition: A time of day, usually in the afternoon or early evening, when a bar or pub offers its drinks at a discounted price
